description.en: The course provides an overview of the ethical and legal challenges of AI systems, (smart) robots and the  (European) legal framework, especially the AI Act.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate eetilistest ja õiguslikest väljakutsetest tehisintellekti süsteemide ja (tarkade) robotite kasutamisest kehtivas (Euroopa) õigusnormistikus ning (tulevikus) kehtivatest võimalustest nende tehnoloogiate kasutamist reguleerida.

objectives.en:
Rapid progress in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and robotics (often operating with a form of AI) is challenging the traditional boundaries of law. AI systems are widely employed to make decisions that have an increasingly far-reaching impact on individuals and society. 
This course examines the opportunities, but also the challenges of AI systems to the existing (European) legal order. Moreover, it provides an analysis of the recently adopted Artificial Intelligence Act of the European Union as well as several key initiatives at the international levels on AI ethics and regulation.
objectives.et:
Kiire areng tehisintellekti (TI) ja robootika valdkonnas (mis tihti töötab teatud vormis TI tehnoloogial) esitab väljakutseid traditsioonilisele õiguse valdkonnale. TI süsteemid on laialdaselt kasutusel, võtmaks vastu otsuseid, mille kaugele ulatuvad tulemid avaldavad mõju indiviididele ja ühiskonnale.
Ainekursus uurib võimalusi, aga ka väljakutseid, mida TI süsteemid esitavad praegu kehtivale (Euroopa) õiguskorrale.
Lisaks annab see ülevaate mitmest võtmetähtsusega initsiatiivist eetika ja õigusregulatsioonide osas rahvusvahelisel ja Euroopa tasemel.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course, students who have passed the subject will have knowledge and understanding of:
learning_outcomes.et: Tudengid, kes läbivad õppeaine, on omandanud teadmised ja arusaamise:

learning_outcomes.en: - the recent technological developments in the field of AI and robotics;
learning_outcomes.et: - viimase aja tehnoloogia arengutest TI ja robootika valdkonnas;

learning_outcomes.en: - the most urgent ethical and legal issues raised by the use of AI systems and (smart) robotics;
learning_outcomes.et: - aktuaalsematest eetilistest ja õiguslikest küsimuskohtadest, mis on tekkinud TI süsteemide ja (tarkade) robotite kasutamisega;

learning_outcomes.en: - applicable legislation, concepts, principles and regulation of AI systems and robotics within the European regulatory framework, especially the AI Act, and the case law of the Court of Justice of the European Union and the European Court of Human Rights in the relevant fields;
learning_outcomes.et: - kohaldatavast õigusnormistikust, kontseptsioonidest, printsiipidest ning TI süsteemidele ja robootikale kohaldatavatest Euroopa õigusraamistiku regulatsioonidest ning Euroopa Kohtu ja Euroopa Inimõiguste Kohtu viimasest kohtupraktikast;

learning_outcomes.en: - key initiatives at the international levels on AI ethics and regulation;
learning_outcomes.et: - võtmetähtsusega eetika ja regulatsioonide initsiatiividest rahvusvahelisel ja Euroopa tasandil;

learning_outcomes.en: - how to analyse legal questions regarding AI and robotics as well as understanding the economic, political and social implications of these technologies.
learning_outcomes.et: - kuidas analüüsida tehnisintellekti ja robootikat puudutavaid õiguslikke küsimusi, saades sealjuures aru nende süsteemide kasutamise majanduslikest, poliitilistest ja sotsiaalsetest mõjuteguritest.

independent_work.et: The independent work consists of preparations for the seminars, the oral presentation during the seminar and the written paper of the presentation.

grade_preconditions.et: Students can pick the date of the seminar where they would like to present their paper.

grade_evaluation.et:
Active Participation in lectures/seminars with a presentation of a pre-selected topic: 40%
Written paper: 60%

Received points for the paper and the presentation will be added to a formula based on these percentages to calculate the overall grade of the course.

debt_elimination.et:
Students who cannot participate in lectures/seminars, will be evaluated on their written paper only.

In all other matters, please refer to the Study Regulations (õppekorralduseeskiri).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
EU's AI Act

*Regulation (EU) 2024/1689 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 June 2024 laying down harmonised rules on artificial intelligence and amending Regulations (EC) No 300/2008, (EU) No 167/2013, (EU) No 168/2013, (EU) 2018/858, (EU) 2018/1139 and (EU) 2019/2144 and Directives 2014/90/EU, (EU) 2016/797 and (EU) 2020/1828 (Artificial Intelligence Act), https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2024/1689/oj?locale=en


European Commission

* Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on Liability for Defective Products COM(2022) 495 final

* Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on adapting non-contractual civil liability rules to artificial intelligence (AI Liability Directive) COM(2022) 496 final

* Liability for Artificial Intelligence and other emerging Technologies, Report of the Expert Group on Liability and New Technologies- New Technologies Formation, 2019 https://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupMeetingDoc&docid=36608

High Level Expert Group on AI, set up by European Commission

* AI HLEG, Ethics Guidelines For Trustworthy AI (Ethics Guidelines), Brussels, April 8, 2019, https://ec.europa.eu/newsroom/dae/document.cfm?doc_id=58477.

* AI HLEG, A Definition of AI: Main Capabilities and Disciplines, Brussels, April 9, 2019, https://ec.europa.eu/newsroom/dae/document.cfm?doc_id=56341.

Council of Europe

* Council of Europe: Framework Convention on AI Artificial Intelligence, Human Rights, Democracy and the Rule of Law, https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2024/1689/oj?locale=en

* European Commission for the Efficiency of Justice (CEPEJ), European Ethical Charter on the Use of Artificial Intelligence in Judicial Systems and their environment, adopted by the CEPEJ during its 31st Plenary meeting (Strasbourg, 3-4 December 2018), CEPJ(2018)14, https://rm.coe.int/ethical-charter-en-for-publication-4-december-2018/16808f699c

UNESCO

* Recommendation on the ethics of artificial intelligence' (SHS/BIO/REC-AIETHICS/2021 No. 68), https://unesdoc.unesco.org/ark:/48223/pf0000380455

OECD

* OECD, Recommendation of the Council on Artificial Intelligence, OECD/LEGAL/0449, adopted on 22 May 2019, https://legalinstruments.oecd.org/en/instruments/OECD-LEGAL-0449

* OECD, interactive database of AI policies and initiatives from countries, https://oecd.ai/countries-and-initiatives
